meanings.definition: Treat (a person or animal) with a vaccine to produce immunity against a disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor inoculates children to protect them from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The nurse inoculates patients with flu shots every year.
meanings.sent3: The superhero dog inoculates all the puppies in the neighborhood to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent4: The idea of kindness inoculates the heart against bitterness.
meanings.sent5: Inoculating against ignorance is like giving the mind a shield of knowledge.

meanings.definition: Introduce (a microorganism or antigen) into a culture medium.
meanings.sent1: Scientists inoculate bacteria into the petri dish for experiments.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician inoculates the virus sample into the test tube.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student inoculates glitter into the classroom's air vents.
meanings.sent4: Curiosity inoculates new ideas into the mind, like seeds in fertile soil.
meanings.sent5: Inoculating creativity into a project can lead to unexpected and exciting results.
